source.d290a4ec:
plt.figure(figsize=(8,6))
df[df['credit.policy']==1]['fico'].hist(bins=35, color='blue', label='credit policy = 1', alpha=0.6)
df[df['credit.policy']==0]['fico'].hist(bins=35, color='red', label='credit policy = 0', alpha = 0.6)
plt.legend()
plt.xlabel('FICO')

source.434eba36: Observation: As fico / credit score is increasing, there is a less interest rate.
source.3e737c33: we can say that there are more people with credit policy = 1. Also people with low FICO score have a credit policy =0.
source.86f1d697: We can see that majority of people were fully paid
source.19da64e1: we can see that debt_consolidation is the major reason to take the loan.
